lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I want to help women in agriculture in other parts of the world.  I hope that by helping another woman, I will improve life for her family and especially for her daughters.  I am personally interested in small-scale agriculture, and I would like to make it possible for more women to make a living from it.
lenders.occupational_info: Managing my household's resources carefully is very important to me.  I have a large garden, keep chickens for eggs, and bake my own bread so that my husband and I can live off of his salary and repay the mortgage on our home quickly.  I love to cook, and I teach cooking classes to adult students.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I hope to positively affect the economic inequalities in the world!

lenders.name: Sayward
lenders.loan_because: I sincerely want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: I  paint and make sculptures and use recycled materials whenever I can.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I'm fortunate to live and work in a developed country.

lenders.name: Courtney
lenders.loan_because: A little can go a long way.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a bank, I go to college and I am a mother.

lenders.name: Maggie
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people in disadvantaged countries improve their lives and the prospects for their children.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an unpaid volunteer worker in my local community.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because:
As a home-based business operator myself, I know the challenges of being an entrepreneur.

I am also one of four women who founded The Grapevine, a non-profit group that monthly surprises a new retail business in Victoria, BC Canada by taking 25 potential new customers to their store and announcing them "best of the bunch for the month" (www.wegrape.ca)
lenders.occupational_info: I help clients eliminate clutter and organize what's left.

lenders.name: Dorian
lenders.loan_because: I´m actually trying to raise some found in order to finish my thesis in ecuador. Moving from the rainforest to the city has been difficult for me. My goal, to get a high education, then go  back my community and help natives as i m part of them too. hope to find some lenders who can help me to acomplish my main goal....
lenders.occupational_info: at the moment  working with some natives communities

lenders.name: Shahla

lenders.occupational_info: She was a children's librarian and a story teller.

lenders.name: Karen
lenders.loan_because: This is a great way to empower other people (especially women!) around the world to grow their own businesses and support their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I am passionate about starting businesses of all kinds and helping other people do the same.

lenders.name: Tekla
lenders.loan_because: I am a mom of three children and I choose to stay at home.  I am a Stylist with Stella & Dot.  In appreciation for my opportunity, I wish to support other women who are operating retail businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell jewellery.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I've been lucky enough to have been given the opportunities to be able to go to school and choose a career where I will make money.  I'd like to give the same opportunity to others- the ability to earn a living without having to worry about where the initial capital will come from.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a dentist.  I work in a hospital and I help patients with toothaches, missing teeth, and those who want to maintain their smiles.  I hope to one day work in pediatrics, treating children.  Once a year, I take a trip somewhere in the world to treat patients who could not otherwise afford or have access to a dentist.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: those who are blessed have a responsibility to give what they can.

lenders.name: Tara
lenders.loan_because: We're all in this together and I can and I want to and I should.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people to improve their health through proper nutrition and supplementation.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in the quality and content of this program
lenders.occupational_info: I am a childcare advocate, I own my own telecommunications business and I have fun with the gift that God gave me, which is the ability to sing and act.

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: From little things, big things grow.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because:
I want to leave a legacy 
How will they remember me? 
Did I choose to love? Did I point to You enough 
To make a mark on things? 
I want to leave an offering 
A child of mercy and grace who
blessed your name unapologetically 
And leave that kind of legacy
lenders.occupational_info: I am a therapist. I work with young children with Autism in hopes to make a difference-one child at a time.

lenders.loan_because: its good karma

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: Loans were made to me.

En ideasmultiples.com servimos a la comuniddad, por eso apoyamos ofreciendo el servicio de hosting totalmente gratuito a fundaciones sin ánimo de lucro dedicadas a ofrecer ayuda a necesitados, a la formación, a la mejora de la calidad de vida y a promover la cultura.

lenders.occupational_info: I help people heal themselves.

lenders.name: Florian

because i love to help and support other people, their ambitions and ideas.

lenders.name: Joy

lenders.occupation: still trying to figure it out

lenders.name: Pauline

lenders.occupational_info: I'm currently studying as a religion student in Texas, with the goal of becoming a United Methodist minister - either a pastor or missionary. lenders.loan_because: We all must continue the cycle of uplifting those around us. I also loan as I intend on fulfilling each and every one of the 10  Covenants (book written by Tavis Smiley)

lenders.name: Kris and Jim

lenders.name: Deborah

lenders.loan_because: Being a small business, we know how hard it is to raise money to expand or start up a business that will be successful. We are also part of the San Diego Microfinance Alliance (http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=5873).

lenders.name: P2PPerpetualFund
lenders.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) engages in poverty alleviating projects. One major project is to provide microloans through the Kiva platform. You can help support P2P by joining our lending team here: http://www.kiva.org/team/poverty2prosperity.
lenders.occupational_info: This is the (P2P) Perpetual Fund account. P2P provides a service for which users can guarantee their funds are perpetually loaned into the future. See the P2P web site for more details.

lenders.name: Bump Babies
lenders.loan_because: I am a mother of 3 and work at home running three companies.  A maternity clothing line,  www.bumpbabies.com, a talent management compnay, www.nebulamanagement.com and a preschool, www.camelotkids.org and I know what it is like to start with nothing and work/strive to achieve goals and dreams.  I moved the the US with $600 and a suitcase and didnt know anybody.  I love to be able to loan to other people who may not have the resources available to help them achieve their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I juggle three jobs so its all about time management and juggling what needs to be done first and then being a mum on top of all of that. Striving for balance on a daily basis.

lenders.name: Asie Voyages
lenders.loan_because:
FRANCAIS:

Les voyages d’aujourd’hui doivent se soucier de la planète et le voyageur, par principe ouvert d’esprit sur les « Autres » se devrait en principe d’être solidaire. En contribuant à ces projets , en finançant des initiatives économiques dans le monde entier, individualisées, clairement identifiables et à taille humaine, en permettant à des population déshérités mais courageuse de subvenir par elle-même à ses besoins, faire vivre leur famille ou améliorer leur niveau de vie , «asie-voyages.com» et ses clients-voyageurs contribuent a redistribuer indirectement une partie de la manne touristique générées par nos pays privilégiés .
En effet si le tourisme génère des centaines de milliards de dollars de revenus ( 733 milliards en 2006) à peine 30 % bénéficient aux populations locales dans les pays émergents. Dans certains cas les retombées sont même inexistantes pour les populations locales déshéritées. Aider ces projets par le micro-crédit c’est notre façon de rendre le tourisme plus équitable, plus responsable , plus solidaire

Par des prêts à taux 0 % plutôt qu’un don , il nous a semblé plus judicieux , mais aussi plus valorisant pour ceux qui en bénéficient , de pourvoir prouver leur capacité à réussir par le travail .

Essayons d’ériger en principe pour un maximum de personnes dans les pays moins favorisés l’expression anglo- saxonne « Trade , no aid »  .

Pour alimenter ce fond , il sera prélevé 1 euro par voyageur sur les frais de dossiers payé à "partir-en-voyage.fr . Les sommes prêtées, une fois remboursées seront ré-investies dans d’autres prêts.

ENGLISH


Today’s travel industry must care about the planet, and as world-citizens aware of others’needs,  travelers should feel concerned. By contributing to the below-mentioned projects, and financing personalized, well-identified, human-sized economic initiatives throughout the world, and allowing poor but courageous populations to be self-supporting, or better their living conditions, "www.partir-en-voyage.fr" and its travelling customers participate indirectly in the redistribution of  part of the tourism revenues generated by our privileged countries. 


 Indeed, if tourism generates hundreds of billions of dollars of revenue (733 billion in 2006) only 30% benefit to local populations in emerging countries. In some cases the benefits are even totally absent for the local poor people . Helping these projects thru micro-credits is our way to make tourism more equitable, more responsible, more caring. 
Lending money without interest,  rather than making a donation , seems not only wiser, but also more meaningful for those who benefit from it, in the sense that they can prove their own abilities for success. 


Let us try to make ours the expression :"Trade, no aid", for as many needful people in emerging countries as possible . 
In order to finance this fund, we propose to set apart 1€ from our booking fees ; once the loaned amount is refunded, it is reinvested into new loans.
lenders.occupational_info:
FRANCAIS:

Nous sommes un voyagiste français proposant des séjours et voyages dans toute l'Asie .Nous essayons dans la mesure du possible de proposer ces voyages et séjours en utilisant des hébergements hors des sentiers battus a chaque fois que nous le pouvons. 

 
WHO ARE WE ?
"asie-voyages.com" is a tour operator and travel agency offering our clients more than 40 destinations around the world. Whenever possible we try to use "off the beaten track" accomodation , to the advantage of the local people.

lenders.name: Prairie & Bill
lenders.occupational_info: We are a young couple with plans of helping the country of Nicaragua. We have found a piece of property that we would like to invest into. Our plans are to subdivide the land and create an eco-friendly development, powered by wind and solar. Once we close on property we will be hiring local people from the community of Tola to help us with reforestation, construction, preservation and tourism. We want to be able to supply jobs to the locals, so they will not have to go far from home for work.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of providing people with the means to improve or invest in their businesses.  I feel that lending  money this way could have a much more sustainable and ongoing impact for others in lieu of making a one time charitable donation.

lenders.name: Stand Against Greed
lenders.loan_because:
I don't have very much money, but compared to whom? In fact, I am in debt! There will always be someone who has less and someone who has more. 

I am glad to be part of a global awakening and I hold out hope that it hasn't come too late.
lenders.occupational_info:
I create artwork relating to urgent subjects pertaining to decent survival on this planet. I have donated the profits from my artwork to a few entrepreneurs on Kiva, and to a local environmental advocacy group here on Vancouver Island.  
I am currently doing a Master's Degree in Environmental Management and work 40 hours a week at an unrelated job to pay the bills. More on what I do at my website
